title: GCSE Biology - Cell Structure (AQA)
subject: Biology
content:
Animal Cells

Animal cells contain several important organelles:

  • Nucleus - Contains genetic material and controls cell activities
  • Cytoplasm - Gel-like substance where chemical reactions occur
  • Cell membrane - Controls movement of substances in/out of cell
  • Mitochondria - Site of aerobic respiration
  • Ribosomes - Site of protein synthesis

Plant Cells

Plant cells have additional structures:

  • Cell wall - Made of cellulose for support
  • Chloroplasts - Contain chlorophyll for photosynthesis
  • Permanent vacuole - Contains cell sap

Remember: Plant cells have all the structures of animal cells plus these additional ones.
